intro: Uropetalon longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved uropetalon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Uropetalon longifolium is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments and is adapted to humid climates.
